Recepti.Opis: Dice onions, chicken breasts and tomatoes. Heat some oil (preferably olive) on a very hot pan and saute diced onions until golden brown. Add chicken and cook until the meat is no longer pink on the outside. Add tomatoes and beans and braise for another 15 minutes on medium heat. Use a spoon to transfer some of the cooked mix into a warm tortilla. Sprinkle some shredded cheese on top and spoon a desired amount of salsa on top. Enjoy warm!

Recepti.Ime: Chicken With Yellow Chanterelle And Spinach
Recepti.Opis: Dice chicken into small cubes. Do the same with mushrooms. Add olive oil to pan and bring to high. Add diced chicken and cook until not pink on the outside. Add mushrooms and spinach and broil for another 20 minutes on low heat. Add cooked rice and enjoy your fresh meal!
Fry the chicken and then add some leaves of green salad.

Spice lamb steaks to your liking and add them into a hot pan with olive oil, some garlic and rosemary. After about 2 minutes add 1 stick of butter and constantly pour it over your lamb steaks. Throw some washed young potatoes into the oven and add pepper, carrots and cherry tomatoes. In the and the lamb steaks on top of the potatoes and cook for another 10 minutes. Serve with a garnish of rosemary.

Lightly spice your chunk of salmon meat. Squeez some lemon on to spiced salmon and insert some garlic into it. Bake until the inside has 145 fahrenheit. Eat it with the side of salad or potatoes. Delicious and quick!

Recepti.Ime: Pizza With Smoked Salmon And Cream
Recepti.Opis: Combine 1 cup (125g) of flour, instant yeast, sugar, and salt in a large bowl. If desired, add garlic powder and dried basil at this point as well. Add olive oil and warm water and use a wooden spoon to stir well very well.Gradually add another 1 cup (125g) of flour. Add any additional flour as needed (I've found that sometimes I need as much as an additional 1/3 cup), stirring until the dough is forming into a cohesive, elastic ball and is beginning to pull away from the sides of the bowl (see video above recipe for visual cue). The dough will still be slightly sticky but still should be manageable with your hands.Drizzle a separate, large, clean bowl generously with olive oil and use a pastry brush to brush up the sides of the bowl. Lightly dust your hands with flour and form your pizza dough into a round ball and transfer to your olive oil-brushed bowl. Use your hands to roll the pizza dough along the inside of the bowl until it is coated in olive oil, then cover the bowl tightly with plastic wrap and place it in a warm place. Allow dough to rise for 30 minutes or until doubled in size. If you intend to bake this dough into a pizza, I also recommend preheating your oven to 425F (215C) at this point so that it will have reached temperature once your pizza is ready to bake.Once the dough has risen, use your hands to gently deflate it and transfer to a lightly floured surface and knead briefly until smooth (about 3-5 times).  Use either your hands or a rolling pin to work the dough into 12 circle.Transfer dough to a parchment paper lined pizza pan and either pinch the edges or fold them over to form a crust.Drizzle additional olive oil (about a Tablespoon) over the top of the pizza and use your pastry brush to brush the entire surface of the pizza (including the crust) with olive oil. Use a fork to poke holes all over the center of the pizza to keep the dough from bubbling up in the oven.Add desired toppings (see the notes for a link to my favorite, 5-minute pizza sauce recipe!) and bake in a 425F (215C) preheated oven for 13-15 minutes or until toppings are golden brown. Slice and serve.

Beat chicken until 1 cm thick. Season it to your liking. Add olive oil to a pan and bring it to medium high. Add your thinned chicken breast into the pan and cook until no longer pink on the outside. Pour cream over the whole mixture and braise for 20 minutes so the chicken taste can integrate itself into the cream sauce. Serve with a side of pasta.

Mix together milk, flour, eggs, vanilla extract and butter. Mix until the mixture is silky smooth. Add coconut oil to the pan for extra spice and pour one full ladle into the pan. Turn around until the mixture is spread in a circle. Flip it over after no longer wet. Remove from the pan and spread topping of choice on top. Maybe sprinkle with some walnuts, nuts or shaved chocolate.

Saute diced onion. Add minced meat and cook until no longer pink. Add shredded carrots (trust me). Cook for 2 minutes and then pour tomato sauce over the whole mixture. Season with basil, oregano, curry, salt and pepper. Braise as long as you can, the longer the better the tastes will mix! Serve with cooked pasta.

Prepare pork steaks in a pan. Season however you like (recommended: rosemary, garlic, butter, salt, pepper). Prepare basmati rice. Serve 2 scoops of rice, 2 pork steaks and pour some sauce over all of it. Garnish with some sexy basil leaves.
